dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two women, obviously tired,fatigued, and with lack of res slowly truck it down a lonely Texas highway. The two, bot both in their own way,  might have  not have shared fashi conversation  all across Texas if they wanted to. They we The girl behind the wheel, a persona that leaked through presence,like icing on a hot cake, gave off the appearanc of the rebel of the group. Her eyes even read "Bad Ass Bitch."-- as she shoved the gear into fifth, and put it o Leslie FINCH The girl (or the more PC term for her is the SCREAM QUEEN on the passenger side, gives off no presence. Almost as i there was no presence to give off. All the signs of In- -teligent life are on the driver's side. Her name is KATE She, is you typical  BUFFY like character. Y'know, No  br a prep/tramp -- you know the type. KATE puts her book down, shining off a look of shee boredom, and like a tractor beam, she points it in the  direction on FINCH, and Finch can't help but look over, because the innocent looking puppy dog face is irresistible. 3 The look is making Finch uncomfortable, and she twists he neck in long-day discomfort, and  sighs. Kate puts on puppy dog face, her eyes deeper, and more  p Finch loses it.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (irritated) Listen! There is nothing to discuss. We are not stopping for the night. We need to just keep on drivin'.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (desperate) Pleeease! ...besides...I can barely keep my eyes open. wh...then what? What happens? I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (beat) Knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We're screwed, royally. And, If I fall asleep...most likely you will too.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: If I get tired,  (sure) Which is not very likely. (calming down) I will, pull over on the side of the rode -- no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ...And get slaughtered, by that ... guy, what's his name? the Texas Chainsaw Massacre. Leather- -face? No honey. I don' think so. We are pulling over in the next town, and we are checkin' into a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH 4
dialogues.text: Kate? Could you please spare me this hacker,slasher bull- -shit. Leatherface? The Texas Chainsaw Massacre? Dammit! Listen to yourself! Four words It's a horror movie. Three more It-aint-real -- Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Finch? I thought you knew.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Know about what, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (seriously concerned) That is a true story, Finch.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: True story my ass... Finch grabs a cigarette from the dashboard, presses the charges the car lighter, after she pushes the button to roll down the window.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am not, for one second; gonna believe that cockamamie bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I did a paper on the guy my junior year. His name is Ed Gein.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Kate, even if he is real, what makes you think he'll find us. What makes you think that I'll run into him? What makes you  think that we are anywhere near him? And listen to me, I'm startin' To think like you are! All that  mumbo jumbo bullshit is rubbin' onto me. 5 The head of the carlighter pops up with a metallic THUD. She yanks it out, and pulls it up to her cigarette, which time, then lights it. She takes a drag with comforting ease, and her eyes roll as she exhales.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What about gas, you are runnin' a little low Finch, College Station would be a perfect stop to get some gas, and sleep for the night.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Kate, Your Roommate has spoken. We are not stoppin'. Not until we reach our destination.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don't have enough gas to get to Huntsville and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I have enough gas, godammit, I have more than half a tank left. Finch takes another drag as Kate continues to aggravate her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Please Finch. I'll pay for both rooms. Separate Rooms for the  both of us. Finch exhales and sighs simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: You could sleep in the car any other night, but nooooo... we're in Texas -- god forbid -- And we have to sleep in a hotel because Kate is afraid of the ....fuckin... what's his name again.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Ed Gein. 6

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: No, that other silly name you  came up with. What was it? Uh...skinface? Scarface? What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Leatherface. Finch looks at her with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: You are Psycho! After that as if on cue, the headlights dim, and the ligh slows down.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Shit! The car CRAWLS to a complete stop, and it COUGHS it's las breath of light, and goes to SHUTDOWN MODE, as it sits th embarrassingly low on juice. Darkness. Don't forget that they are in the middle of the woods, with no streetlights, and no houses for miles. The only source of light is the cherry on Finch's cigaret

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Are you graspin' the situation? 'Cause in case you are, we are stuck out here because the battery is dead. The battery that you said was fine, and if you would have stopped when I asked you too, we- -would-not-be-in-this-situation! Finch gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up. I'm graspin' the situation Katlin. I do real- -ize the situation at hand. And if you would shut up for one  second, maybe I grasp a solution to the situation! Shut the fuggup! (she pauses) All right, I thoughtta somthin'. 7

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: We get out, push the car onto the side of the road, and we  sleep. They are blinded by a set of headlights coming down the of the engine, gives the fact away that it is a truck, a HUGE, LOUD truck.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Thank God, maybe he's gotta battery. The TRUCK rides into view, making the once dark highway light as day (within a certain radius).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TALL MAN hops out of the truck, and makes a bee-line over to the car. He YANKS a flashlight from his utility belt, and shines it into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flashlight, BLINDS the girl's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Shit. Finch rolls down the window, and extends a hand to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Hi. The TALL MAN turns off the flashlight, and puts forward h hand to greet hers.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Hi. 8

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like ya have a problem with your car, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... Our battery it's ...kinda screwed. The TALL MAN let's out a war-hearted laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Well, me'n my brother, we'd be glad to help.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry about it ma'am. It's a pleasure. Anything to help out a couple of nice girls as y'self.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thank You.

dialogues.speaker: TALL MAN
dialogues.text: Hi, m'names Vilmer.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Kate, and this (pointing to Finch) is Finch. The VILMER tips his cowboy hat with his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Much obliged. Well... There isn't a town out here for miles. Now... I on the other hand, live just a few miles down the road, and it just so happens, we have a brand new battery in he shed that's just achin' to be used. Kate smiles, charmed by Vilmer's SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH 9
dialogues.text: Thanks Vilmer, we'd appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yeah, the way I see it, we'll head back to my place, get you girls a battery, and we'll have you back on the road in about an hour. But for the meantime, we'll have to get your car off the road, and yall kind ride  with me.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Well, we wouldn't want to be an inconvenience. I mean... we can wait here if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (concerned) Oh, lord no! I wouldn't leave two lovely ladies such's y'self out here in the dark, that's just not right. The two girls smile IMPRESSED by his bedside manner.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: N'besides, yall two look a little tired, we'll make sure you get somthin' to eat before you get back on the road.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (thankful) Oh...thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: It's no problem at all.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: You really wouldn't mind.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Of course not, me'n my brothers, well... we'd love to have you for dinner. 10 Finch lets out a warm smile, looks at Kate; then back to Vilmer.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Well... if it's no convenience... we'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Great. Now... we need to get this car off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vilmer and his brother BONES are pushing the car off to the side of the road, and are finishing the job as of now The two brothers walk over to the two ladies, who are by their truck, Kate: Trying to keep warm, and Finch: Smokin a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Finch, Kate. I'd like you to meet my brother, Bones.

dialogues.speaker: KATE FINCH
dialogues.text: Hi Bones.           Hi, how are you. Bones strikes us as a kind-sorta STRANGE person. He speaks in a rapid pace, stuttering, and running almost all of his words together.

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Hi, ladies, Hi ladies, how do you do, I'm fine, I'm fine, of course I'm fine, but that's not the case, of course we're we're talking about you, and you look fine, you do look fine, but thats why I'm asking you, I'm asking you (to Vilmer) Ohhh (laughter of joy) they look marvelous don't they, simply 11

dialogues.speaker: BONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marvelous, They're pretty pretty ladies, pretty, yes  they are, wonderful simply wonderful. (to the ladies) How do you do, you do look  lovely, you do, you do, look at me I'm rambling, I'm  rambling, I'm rambling --  I need to stop, but you do you do, seriously you do you look very lovely you do.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Bones, that's very nice of you. (to the ladies) C'mon, I'll show you the back back cab. Vilmer escorts the two ladies to the cab, leaving Bones, who gets in on the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I don't mean to say something that offends you but...

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Oh..Bones (smiles) He's all right, it's just that well... ever since his mother died, he's been a little on the depressed side, and the way he talks is just how... I dunno ... how he deals with it.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I asked, Vilmer.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Oh, No problem. C'mon let's get to it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE 12
dialogues.text: Okay, we promise, we'll be quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Talk all you want, but, I'll be in front, and if you want a  beer or somthin' there's some  in the cooler. The two girls hop into the back cab.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Thanks Vilmer, we really do appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Ya'll be careful back there. Kate shuts the door to the back cab and Vilmer walks around to the front cab and gets in, and they ride off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vilmer and the ladies are having a conversation, while Bones holds his small handheld radio, listening intently in his own private world.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Vilmer, I'm sorry, I forgot to ask, but... do you mind if I smoke?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yeah I mind... but now... if you offer me one... I uh... might change my mind. Finch let's out a warm hearted laugh.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (laughs) Fair enough. Finch pulls out her pack of cigarettes, and hands him   1 one. Vilmer accepts it. Pulls out his shiny silver zippo, and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (coughing) You need to quit smoking.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (blowing smoke in Kate's face) What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (irritated) Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck turns a swift corner, and starts to drive down a lonely road, with no name. No lights, and the howls of a thousand wolves. As they speed down the road into darkness, eventually, they disappear into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is showing slight sense of discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So... Do you live down here?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yeah... It's a more charmin'

dialogues.speaker: VILMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: in the mornin', when you can   14 actually see the place. Used to be a big game preserve,be- -fore our family bought it.

dialogues.text: The truck pulls up to a backwoods country house. Noticeab only because of the lights that are on inside. The four in the truck get out. But our attention is not trail that leads behind the barn. We turn the corner, and PAN AROUND to reveal the backside of the barn. What we see is completely out of the ordinary. Tied to the barn, hanging,swinging in the wind is a head- -less nude female corpse -- gutted and bleeding on the mu On the ground, a mound of flesh, insides, and red mesh is attracting a swarm of flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's normal. Typical, and most of all comforting. Obvious a deadly cover. The front door enters into the dining roo which is connected to the kitchen. The far wall is connected to a threshold, which leads us the living room. On the right end, are a set of recliners, separated by  c On the extreme right is a Entertainment Center, You have family pictures. In front of the  entertainment center, i comfortable, it's back is to us -- and if someone is sitt tell. The TV glows in the dim-lit room. 15 Vilmer and Bones open the door in the Kitchen, escorting

dialogues.text: You two ladies wait right here. I want to check and  see if my older brother's got his clothes on. (to Bones) Bones, keep'em company okay?

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Righty-O, Righty-O. Vilmer walks into the living room -- over to the chair in front of the TV. He stay over by the threshold as Vilmer lays it all down whisper. It is faint but we can hear some of it.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Found some fresh meat Mom. The character, a MAN, speaks back to him in whisper.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Good for you, son -- I'm  very proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Thank you momma.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Do they know anything?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Not yet momma, just the way you like it. And their both pretty, pretty ladies.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Son, you did a good thing, Now... when Jefferson gets here... You can make'em just

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: how you like'em.     16 Vilmer obviously loving, and caring for whoever's in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Thank you momma. Vilmer leans over to the MAN, his face hidden by the back of the chair. We hear a soft SMOOCH. Vilmer gets up and heads back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Finch? Kate? I'll show you where the battery is after dinner, but for now, we need to wait for my brother Jefferson. He should be here any second. So while we wait, why don't we just sit down, and talk a little bit. (pause) I don't say this often -- probably because we dont get much company but... It's nice to have you here because me'n Bones, we really don't get out much.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Thanks Vilmer.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: My brother should be here. A FLASH from outside headlights make the dim-lit house go bright. A smile spreads on Vilmer's face.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well, Well. Speak of the Devil. A skinny man, semi-good looking - kind of a rugged handsomeness, walks into the kitchen door, sporting a police uniform. 17

dialogues.speaker: GOOD LOOKING MAN
dialogues.text: Hey Vilmer!

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Hey man, how ya doin'! (to the ladies) Ladies, this is my brother Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Hi, Jefferson

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Hello ladies.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: We were just about to sit down and have a little chit chat. Jefferson looks at the two ladies with a polite smile.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Vilmer? Do you mind if I use the ladies room.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry little lady, but... when your a guest with of a bunch of a heterosexual males... I'm afraid your gonna have to improvise with what we got. Finch laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I guess that'll do.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: KATE 18
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I go too? I have to go put my make- -up on.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Thanks. The two ladies get up and head to the restroom, which pas the den. The two brothers look at each other, with a gaping grin.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Now it's on.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Oh, baby!

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Run out to the shed'n get the chainsaw, and my shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch is sitting on the pot, while Kate is leaning over the counter, looking into the mirror, while she puts on h

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They seem like nice people

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferson scrambles into the shed and grabs the chainsaw. And looks around for the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two ladies, still talking.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: D'you smell that. Finch sniffs, and makes a disgusted face.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (grossed out) Yeah, what the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jefferson finds the shotgun, and the carton of shells and he starts to load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two girls look almost nauseated by the smell.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (pointing to shower curtain) I think it's coming from in there. Finch is zipping up her pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jefferson running from the shed into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms in, and tosses Vilmer the shotgun, and enters the living room and goes to the chair, and hands whatever behind the chair the massive chainsaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two ladies are standing in front of the shower curtai They can see a shadowy figure behind the curtain, but the Finch yanks the shower curtain back. Kate tries to scream bloody murder, but Finch covers her trying not to scream.  20 We get a look at what they want to scream about. A bathtub, filled ankle high with blood, and planted in the blood are ripped off arms, legs, and an entire torso area. And on the shower nozzle, planted on it -- was a decapita head. It's mouth open -- it looked as if it was alive -- it would scream.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (genuinely terrified and quiet) What the fuck? What the fuck? What the fuck are we gonna do? When I take my hand away from your mouth -- you promise -- you promise me goddammit -- that you will not scream. Kate nods her head, a stream of tears roll from both eyes Finch let's go, and she runs for the toilet -- and vomits There is a KNOCK-KNOCK-KNOCK at the door, followed by two sinister high-pitched redneck-laughs

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (catching breath) Who is it.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (mimicking shark on Saturday Night Live) Mammogram. Followed by some more sinister laughs.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (screams) Vilmer!

dialogues.speaker: VILMER, (OS)
dialogues.text: (imitating Lurch) Yoooouuuu Rrrraaannng? More Deranged redneck-laughs.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER, (OS)
dialogues.text: We're gonna count to three then we ah comin' in.

dialogues.speaker: BONES, (OS)
dialogues.text: Oh!!!(his laugh) Drumroll drumroll, I'll do a drum- -roll, drumroll -- watch this. (makes drum beating sound)

dialogues.speaker: ONE
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: TWO
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: THREE
dialogues.text: The door creaks open. -- Silence. The mesquitoes buzzing from outside.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (scared) Kate we gotta get out of here now. Kate, still hugging the toilet, strains to get up with Vomit induced siliva dripping from her mouth -- her face a pure red -- stained with tears.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (sniffling, scared) There around the corner, I know they are, I know they are. We're gonna walk out of this bathroom and their gonna, do to us, what they did to that girl in the bathtub!

dialogues.speaker: FINCH 22
dialogues.text: I'm gonna peek outside, you stay here.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (objecting,scared) Don't go, they'll get you I don't want to be alone Dont' leave me here! (crying) I dun wanna di... She is crying so hard she can't talk.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Don't worry I'll be right here, I'm just  gonna go take a peek. Finch tip-toes over to the door, leans against the wall, and takes a deep breath. The house is amazingly quiet. We can hear the screen door on the opposite end of the living room CREAK open, and SLAM closed, repeatedly. She takes one more deep breath, and exhales -- then peers looks out to the right of the threshold -- then to the left. Both sides -- empty. She walks back over to Kate, who is about to have a nervo breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Okay, you see that door at the end of the living room... Kate nods her head, sniffling.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: We are gonna make a run for it. That's it. That's all Kate needed to hear to set off what looked like pure fear. She peed in her pants, and  floor got splattered with urine.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH 23
dialogues.text: (whisper) Kate. Don't do this now! We need to run. Let's go! now! Finch grabs Kate and they run towards the door. They hit the screen door open, and speed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two ladies bolt into the woods, running at LUDICHRIST SPEED. They can hear the brother's YAHOOING in the background, a they TEAR ASS through the woods -- chasing after them. We can hear the truck driving around -- getting to closer Eventually the girls come across, a vast incaved clearing -- which looks like a dried up lake. The take a run down into it. There are enough trinches, and used-to-be islands -- for it to be considered A GREAT PLACE TO HIDE. The truck drives up to the edge of the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vilmer and Jefferson HOP out, Bones is nowhere to be foun While the dark figure that was in the chair remains in th

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I'll take care of'em for ya Momma -- don't you worry. The dark figure remains silent in the back of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (to Jefferson) C'mon Jeff, we got some prime rib 'needs skillin'.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON 24
dialogues.text: Now you're talkin'!

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: All right! The girls are hiding behind a mound of gray soil, which i mulched in with chopped bark, and dead pine needles, as t hop out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (scared) Finch?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (scared and crying) You said there was no such thing. You said he wasn't real! You said --

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) Nevermind what I said -- okay? You were right, I should have listened to you. Obviously, Kate is in shock -- and Finch is just telling Kate what she wants to hear.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (in shock) I'm scared, Finch. I'm scared. I don't want to die here. Finch grabs her by her shoulders and gives her a good sha

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) Listen! If you keep this up we will die here! You to get your ass in gear -- and stop bringing down the fuckin' house! The headlights of the truck go out -- so do the post lights surrounding the dock.      25 Pitch blackness.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How are we gonna get out of  here?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Shhhh. (whispering) You hear that? Kate focuses here hearing -- we HEAR the Gravel, which surrounds the pit's floor BREAK -- footsteps HEAVY FOOTST getting louder -- every time a step heard.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (mouthing the words) "Oh, shit." The footsteps stopped. Within their radius -- yet unseen in the midnight blue.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) Kate, Kate! we gotta move. A flare -- fired up in front of them/ with no one around it. No sounds except for the HISSING of the flare.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let's go. Intended to make us jump out of our seats -- something ru past them. They notice it and jump. Faintly, in the background -- we can hear the shotgun go ,and the faint buzz of a saw of some sort. At the far corner of the pit -- Finch could make out  26 flashed to life. A decapitated head, stuck on a pole, was lit on fire used as a guidance tool -- obviously for the brothers. Then another head/torch lit up on the other corner. then another corner. then another. Flaming heads at all ends of the pit. To make you jump again -- something rushes past them. Another flare bursted to life on the opposite side as the Still, no one to be seen. Still the faint sounds of buzz... A HUGE MAN, BURSTS out from nowhere, wielding a MASSIVE CHAINSAW in a split second, and CUTS Finch on the ankle before she could runaway. Finch hits the ground -- grabbing her ankle screaming in pain. While Kate runs for it. Scared for her life, Blinded with fear, she runs right into the arms of  Jeffe

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Hi ya! Sweetheart! Vilmer runs up to the two. -- Vilmer looks at the man with the chainsaw. We finally get a good look at him. Long dark hair -- wearing a mask, made out a fragments of other people's faces -- a white button-up dress shirt, match his black leather slacks and black leather jacket -- Holding a HUGE chainsaw, with engraving

dialogues.speaker: CU ENGRAVING
dialogues.text: Etched on the saw reads " The Saw Is Family " 27

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (troubled) Momma! Leatherface looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (sad) Momma, I said I'd take care of it for ya! Leatherface speaks perfect English, with a deep powerful voice.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Vilmer -- I'm sorry baby! You know I didn't mean to upset you. Vilmer goes over to Leatherface, and hugs him, and you can slightly detect a tear in Vilmer's eye.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (muffled) I was gonna give'em to you as a present Momma!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: There, there, it's all over  now -- Son it's the best present I've ever received.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (crying) I wanted it to be a surprise Momma!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Look at you! Your such a big boy --  (babying him) Look at this Vilmer -- you got two birds with one stone. Such a good little helper. Vilmer lifts up his face, which was buried in Leatherface shoulder, and looks at him with a teary eye. 28

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I love you momma! Leatherface removes his mask to show a normal -- in-fact handsome face -- unshaven. But not deformed in anyway. He ties his long hair back into a pony-tail.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Come Vilmer! -- Let us eat dinner!

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Please don't cuff me. I've had to wear cuffs for the last ten  years of my life -- I'll do what you tell me to, as long as... as long as...

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Yes dear?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I want you to make it quick. I don't want to die slowly. Leatherface walks up to her, and puts his hand on her  sh

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: What's your name dear?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Leslie. Leslie Finch, My friends call me Finch, though.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: May I call you Finch?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Does it really matter?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE 29
dialogues.text: To me it does.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Finch, you do as your told, I'll make it as quick as  possible. Leatherface looks at her hands. He picks them up, and put them up to his nose, and takes a big whiff.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: You smoke, yes?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Regrettably.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Might you spare one to me? Finch pulls out her pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: They're menthol, you sure?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Menthol, even better. Finch draws a cigarette from the pack and hands it to Leatherface. Leatherface accepts it, and presses the filter between hi He pulls out a zippo from his pocket -- unlike your zippo usual cover -- this lighter was covered with skin. He lit his cigarette. They start walking out of the pit, in rows of two: Finch by Leatherface, Vilmer by Kate, And Jefferson  trai

dialogues.speaker: FINCH 30
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: My name is Ed Gein the third.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Are you related to the Ed Gein in Wisconsin?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Yes, I am. We... we are his family.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I thought all of you were caught about five years back.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: No, not entirely. Y'see -- what we do as a family, is what several families did twenty years back. What few families did, a few years back. And it's what we do now. All of our families, spread out across Texas, we all follow Edward, some families even thought of him as a god. I saw him a grandfather, and a damn good one at that. But all of the other families, Ten in all -- have either been caught, or been outsmarted by their own food. Leatherface smiles as the walk up the hill and out of the pit.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Y'see, we're not monsters. To you yes, we may well be -- but you have to understand that it's  nothing personal. Your just our meal ticket.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: I've seen your movies. Leatherface crackles a flim-laden laugh.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE 31
dialogues.text: Their somthin' aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: It's just... Well...

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: I know, all they guys with the leather mask and the chain- -saw, are few cans short of a six pack -- I know this. But it doesn't bother me, I mean it's just a movie -- they do it for ratings and I can respect that.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Ed, what are you going to do with us when we get back to the house?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Well, we are going to eat supper, you are going to watch, and then This hellhole you call life will have just been a terrible dream as you journey to your unknown destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kitchen/Dining Room is empty, and quiet, accept for the HMMMM of the a/c unit in the living room. Leatherface, Finch, Vilmer, Kate, and Jefferson enter.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Vilmer, tie the ladies down please.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. Finch looks at Vilmer in a funny way. As if not  understa situation. Vilmer goes into the kitchen and bends down out of view. He reappears with two handfuls of cargo rope. 32 Vilmer advances toward the two girls. Kate, the whole time -- almost in a trance-like state looking down at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: If you ladies'll please have a seat. Finch takes a seat at the dinner table, while Kate contin to stand -- lost in her own world. Vilmer escorts her gently to a seat at the dinner table,

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: I'm going to go check on bones, and see how the food's comin'. Leatherface exits the House.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Vilmer. Vilmer is in the middle of tying them up.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: We got a drugbus' t'day? Vilmer looks up with a serious face.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (interested) You got something for me. Tell me you got sumthin'. Jefferson smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: I might, it all depends on how much money you got. Vilmer finishes tying the girls up, and walks over to  33 Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I got about two-hundred.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Good enough. Vilmer claps his hands, and JUMPS up and down, with pure enjoyment.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Jefferson, you are a good man.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Anything for my favorite  brother. Vilmer grabs him and gives him a great big man-like hug. Leatherface and Bones ENTER the house through the KITCHEN door. Leatherface is empty handed, but Bones, enters with a hug meat. Bones speaks, with a cigarette hanging from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: Soups on! Soups On! Ladies ladies come have some meat with us it's delicious, delicious -- you'll love it, just love it. He sets the meat down onto he table. Leatherface sets the table with plates -- no utensils. Jefferson opens up the fridge, and pulls out a jug of mil and grabs four glasses, then works his way to the table as he sets down the drinks. The four of them sit down Finch looks down at the dinner table -- it now has a tabl cloth on it made out of sewed and stitched human skin.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE 34
dialogues.text: Well... let's eat. The four guys grab some body parts from the tray and star to chow down. Vilmer grabs a hand -- a grilled hand, and starts to eat as if it were a chicken leg. Kate sees it, and starts to shake in fear. Jefferson takes the face -- uncooked and cuts a slice off of it, and sets the face back onto the tray. Bone grabs what looks to be some sort of cooked genitalia and start to chew. We can literally see Kate, breaking down. Finch, closes her eyes. Leatherface cuts up the gutted uncooked torso, and breaks out a rib and starts to chow down. Kate is losing her mind -- you can see it in her eyes. Finch still has her eyes closed. We can HEAR, the RIPS, and CRUNCHES, CHOMPS of the cannib as they eat their dinner. Kate's gives off a presence of purebred fear. She looks at Vilmer, eating the hand up, and breaking off the bone. She looks at Jefferson, eating the slice of the face -- h She looks at Bones, curled up, knawing on the genitals Then she turns to Leatherface, eating the bloody rib, the loose tender meat dropping off of the bone, and out of hi mouth. It all sinks in to her -- She's completely aware. She screams a HELLISH CRY OF THE BANSHEE, as she looks up and closes her eyes.       35 She wets her pants, and her water splatters on the floor. The Cannibals continue to CHOW DOWN. Until we hear another scream, a muffled one in the b.g. from below. Vilmer slams his hand down on his plate.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Goddammit! He get up and walks into the Kitchen, and bends down, and lifts up what sounds like a trap door.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: What the... hell do you want! A muffled female voice OS talks back.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: (desperate) I hungry, I real real hungry.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: What happened to the last batch of shit I gave you?!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: I ate it all. Vilmer makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: You what? You ate it all?! Jesus Christ! I gave you that batch yesterday. She whispers something. Finch pays attention, fascinated, yet scared.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: All right, all right, what do   36 you want? (pause) Make it quick, I in the middle of eating. (pause) Let's see. Vilmer walks around the kitchen, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: We got some bananners, more bananners... some apples. (pause) No? Well, you want some cereal? (pause) It's either fruit of cereal. (pause) It's either fruit or cereal. (pause) Both? All right. He grabs two boxes of cereal and a plastic bag of fruit a

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Don't ask me for anymore shit 'till the mornin' aight? (pause) Okay, g'night Shelly. He slams the door, and locks it, he gets up, and walks  t He sits down, picks up the hand he was eatin' on, and thr it back on the plate.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: It done got cold.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: The family and the hostages are still at the Dinner Table The tray is empty, and their plates are a bloody mess. 37 Leatherface is leisurely chewing on a fat cigar, while Vilmer and Jefferson are smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Who's Momma?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Momma couldn't eat with us tonight.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (to Vilmer) I heard you call Edward  Momma. Vilmer bursts up from his chair, in a spit of rage -- he grabs the knife from the table and puts it up to Finch's neck.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: That's a GOD DAMNED LIE!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Vilmer...Put the knife down, is that anyway to treat your  guests?

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Who was that... below the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: That was the Black Sheep of the family.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I told that bitch she could come upstairs and live like a normal human bein', She aint movin' a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: Then, why is she down there.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: That bitch refuses to eat   38 meat.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: What kinda meat?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: The only kind there is that's worth eatin'!

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: You keep her down there because she refuses to eat her own race? Why don't you just kill her, like you are with me'n Kate.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Because she... (pause) ... she's family. She's Vilmer's little sister. Yep.... Vilmer tried so hard to teach her to do the right thing...but, in the end... Leatherface points to the trap door in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: We did the only thing we could do.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: So you keep her locked down there like a... like a child reject.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Exactly Ms. Finch -- Vilmer, time play in the barnhouse. Jefferson interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, It's my turn.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: It'll be your turn tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON 39
dialogues.text: No! I kept lookout for the past three nights!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: The last two nights, You keep lookout one more night, then it'll be your turn, I promise. Jefferson looks up, as if he's trying to think.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: I'm goin' tomorrow night, I'll remember you said that.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Okay, Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: We gonna invite these two ladies?

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: No, there's more than plenty in there now. Vilmer gets up.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: So what are we gonna do with these two while we're gone? Leatherface places his cigar in the mouth of the head, that was eaten from.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Tie 'em up in the Cellar.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: I'll take the liberty of doin' that.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER 40
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jefferson.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: Hey man, No problem. Jefferson gets up, and starts to help the ladies up, whil Leatherface head back to the back of the house, and Vilme

dialogues.speaker: JEFFERSON
dialogues.text: What're yall usin' tanight?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: We're using the family chainsaw. Jefferson lets out an evil grin. Vilmer gives an evil grin back then EXITS the house.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: Wherever we are, there are alot of people, but their all breathing heavy, and the chitter-chatter of all the scare and unreasonable voice are mixed -- only to sound like  gibberish. The light FLASH ON -- we're in a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are at least TEN victims in the barnhouse. All  sca hey that is scattered  throughout. The front door of the barn opens, and ALL OF THE PEOPLE step back, FRIGHTENED by the UNKNOWN. Vilmer walks in, PUMP ACTION SHOTGUN in hand.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: (cocking shotgun) Ladies and Gentlemen! Now! The moment you've all been waiting for! That Deranged,

dialogues.speaker: VILMER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Disturbed, Skin-wearin' Psychotic  41 brother of mine! (imitates boxing announcer)

dialogues.speaker: LEEEEEAAAATTTHHHH--ERRRRFAAAACCCE
dialogues.text: Leatherface enters the room with his chainsaw in hand. But he looks different: He's wearing a woman's skin -- all over his body, and wearing an oversized tacky-faded dress with poka-dots on it -- and he's also wearing another one of his leather masks. He's also carrying a huge chainsaw, HUGE, and on the side of the blade that we see, it reads " WHO WILL SURVIVE" He raises the chainsaw up in the air and he lets it roar, and when he does that, we can read the other side: " AND WHAT WILL BE LEFT OF THEM?". Vilmer shuts the door and locks them in, locking several DEADBOLTS, and MASTER KEY LOCKS. In Vilmer's right hand is a boombox -- he sets it down an turns it on. It blares a HEAVY METAL SONG, while the two run around playing a DEADLY GAME OF CAT AND MOUSE. Vilmer takes aim at the fleeting hurd, who is progressing fires -- and blast a middle-aged man's leg off. He runs over to the helpless man laying on the ground and shoots him in the face -- several times; causing the man' head to spatter all over Vilmer and on the hay-laden floo Leatherface takes a running slice at a young man, slashin his entire head/torso area off.  Vilmer reloads. Leatherface turns the chainsaw off. Vilmer tosses the shotgun over to Leatherface -- he catch it. Leatherface tosses the chainsaw to Vilmer -- he catches i Vilmer corners a lady in a corner of hay, he takes the  c flies, covering him  completely. We can hear her blood-curtling sounds, he backs up, and r stomach -- she screams even louder. He steps back and runs back into her, butting off her arm completely, and he's sawing her with one hand, and bashin the other. She's dead. He cut's her head off, and runs around with it in his han screaming like a wild Indian. Leatherface has a young teenage female saddled, he has th head, tightly, he pulls the  trigger, the entire top of h

dialogues.text: A BLACK MAN is getting down from his tripod, after a long He begins to unload his rifle.

dialogues.text: Vilmer runs up to a teenage girl, in a FAR CORNER, he rai the chainsaw up. He looks DEMENTED, BLOOD COVERED FACE, eyes BULGING, like lunatic, and JACK NICHOLSON'S DEVILISH GRIN. The girl SCREAMS, letting all air from her lungs escape, which to Vilmer, proves to be really loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Man, still unloading hears the BLOOD CURTLING

dialogues.speaker: SCREAM. 43
dialogues.text: He looks up. We can FAINTLY HEAR the BUZZ of a chainsaw. Then another scream -- the buzzes and the screams are constant. He looks down at his gun -- and starts to load the bullet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leatherface has the shotgun hanging on his shoulder, as he's beating an old man with his own, ripped-off leg. Then finally taking the shotgun to his face at close rang Vilmer runs up to a middle-aged woman, and starts to saw He halfway done sawing her -- he hold her legs with his right hand, and kicks her in the torso, and the top half The two killers exchange weapons again. Vilmer takes aim at a regressing victim -- He fires The victim's head explodes all over a Teen-aged boy. The boy looks at Leatherface who comes forward with the Leatherface stabs the chainsaw into his gut -- and starts cut in a round symmetrical motion, carving a hole in his stomach. The boy hits the hay -- dead, a bloody mess. We get an overview of the damage. The barn, is a BLOODY scattered through out. They hey and walls -- what used to be a faded yellow -- now, a CRIMSON RED -- with faint traces of Yellow -- which is ALMOST non-existent. Vilmer picks of another suspecting victim with his trusty shotgun.       44 Leatherface, gives the chainsaw one quick swift swing and slices off a man's legs, as the victim tumbles to the He then runs over to another man -- who is trying to run back open -- he slides the  chainsaw (which is strapped) both of his hands on both of her shoulders. He gives her swift kick through the gaping hole in her ba ,which causes her stomach to explode, and leatherfaces' f He then lets her drop to the ground, putting his fee leg stuck leg out of the body,  removing the high heel he was All the victims have been slain, accept one -- a teenage girl, possibly early twenties. The runs like decapitated chicken -- in everywhich way but the killers. Vilmer takes the rifle to her arm, and blows it completel off -- only hanging by a flap of skin that used to cover elbow joint. She hit the ground -- falling to her knees. A look of disbelief on her face, maybe even denial. Like this is no Leatherface, roars up the chainsaw -- she doesn't move -- probably scared shitless at the time. He presses the chainsaw against her leg, and he starts to completely separated from the body. Then Vilmer takes the separated leg and rams it into her as he can. The impact hits her at such a force which causes her to Leatherface, presses the chainsaw through her neck, as  V shotgun repeatedly until he is completely out of shells. 45 They look around the barn -- enjoying their masterpiece

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: This is the best one we've had in a good long while Momma.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Yeaht... I'll have'ta give you that one. (laughs) We tore them motherfuckers up -- DIDN'T WE!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's go get cleaned up and carve up those two beautiful women -- shall we?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: That sounds like a mighty fine idea -- Then, maybe afterwards (sadness, weak) You think maybe you could... Well... I miss you Momma.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Honey (hand on cheek) After what you did today... There's no doubt in my mind. You will not go unrewarded tonight. Vilmer gives Leatherface a huge affectionate hug, and  kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: I love you Momma!

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: I know, son, I know -- I love you too. 46 The two exit the barn, Leatherface's arm around Vilmer's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunter is walking around the house, trying to  distin coming from -- not sure if it was this place. He walks up to the Kitchen Entrance Door, and raps a few He hears some muffled sounds, strange sounds, then the do flies open, and Vilmer, sticking his head out of the door -- now clean.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Hi, can I help you stranger?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: Hi, My names Ashe Harrison, I was huntin' a few acres back and I thought I heard some screams... Are yall aight?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Screams? (confused) I didn't hear any screams.

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: You didn't hear those screams? Lordy, they be loud enough to wake up, your neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: We don't have any neighbors. Ashe Harrison whips him on the collar bone, and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: Exactly. Ashe bursts out in a loud high-pitched laughter.  47 Vilmer can't help but laugh with him.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Naw, can't say that I heard anything -- So, d'you kill anything?

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: 'scuse me?

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: D'you kill anything, y'know -- you said you were hunting...

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah -- thasright, sorry... No, no -- didn't get nothin' ts'been a slow year.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can understand that. Well, hey... don't be stranger come in -- have a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: Well, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Hey, no problem, man. Vilmer lets him in and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leatherface is now in normal attire, her has the two girl by the neck in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: I've been nice before, now it's time to get to it. You white-trash whores say a fuck- -ing word, make so much as a fucking sound -- I'll will  torture you -- all night long  if I have to -- Do you understand? The two nod their heads. 48 Leatherface walks into the living room, then into the  ki

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Ashe, this is my brother, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: ASHE
dialogues.text: Hi Ed. Ashe extends his hand. Leatherface fronts his to accept it.

dialogues.speaker: LEATHERFACE
dialogues.text: Hi, how you doin'. Let's go into the living room, and get aquatinted. (to Vilmer) Vilmer, you put the coffee on.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Will do. Leatherface leads Ashe into the living room They both sit down, Leatherface's back is to the threshol while Ashe can look into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finch and Kate are listening in, Kate, more awake and mor intently.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering) I got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Unbutton your shirt, 49

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it. Finch unbuttons her shirt. Kate pulls out some lipstick, and begins to write somethi right under her neck.

dialogues.speaker: FINCH
dialogues.text: (whispering) What are you doing? Kate finishes writing whatever she wrote, and peered into see the black man, and  Leatherface had his back to them.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering) I want you to walk out in front of the threshold, and show the sign -- make sure you keep him quiet. She puts her finger on her mouth, in a " shhh." gesture

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (whispering) Like that. Take a deep breath and do it. Finch takes a deep breath, and lets it out quietly. Then stands out in front of the threshold. Ashe looks up while Leatherface is complaining to Vilmer about the coffee, he sees the lipstick-written message Under her neck he sees the large letters -- in print.

dialogues.speaker: "HELP US"
dialogues.text: Finch puts her finger up to her closed lips, SHHH. She then draws back into the darkened hallway. Ashe looks concerned, but keeps a poker face, when  Leath

dialogues.text: Leatherface drags her through the living room, still  scr

dialogues.speaker: -ING BITCH

dialogues.text: Like a butcher shop almost, but much, much worse. He drags Leatherface into the back of the place, and pulls him up on a cutting table. Vilmer takes his jacket off, and rolls up his sleeves.

dialogues.text: Finch is lost, she running everywhich direction but the she's trapped. Her hands are a bloody mess from the burns.

He walks around to where his feet are, spreads them, and sheet with a scalpel in hand. Skin pops loose faster than you can screw a Looseiana whore. We CUT TO a picture of Hands stitching skin together We CUT TO: 66

As a shield Vilmer sees Bones, and starts to shake with sheer burstin

dialogues.text: Finch decides to lay down by a tree trunk, catching her She reaches in her shirt pocket for a cigarette, and pull out a beaten up -- twisted around cigarette, and she ligh She takes a drag and exhales -- shuttering her eyes with a great sense of satisfaction. Then, a snap of a branch in the b.g. of darkness. Footsteps. Coming closer. She looks around, intent, and now frightened. 69 The footsteps come closer, louder, and breaking more fallen limbs, and crushing more leaves. She breathes heavily, in and out -- seeing her breath from the night's cool crisp autumn air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night-Vision, he can see her perfectly, a few feet away. She's looking in every which direction, including his, bu not seeing him, because it is so dark. -- Vilmer looks  a daylight, almost. And he could  see, the victims of the p winds. He sneaks up to her, and puts his hand out in front of he waving it in front of her. She not budging. He rubs his hand across her cheek -- she jumps.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Leslie? Leslie Finch? Are you out there? Are you breathing in the dark? Are you... scared? You want to fuck me Finch? ...Maybe suck my cock? Finch looking around -- cannot see vilmer anywhere -- onl

dialogues.text: I seeee yoooou. I seeee you, you fucking whore. You think I would let you live? You killed my fucking mother! Finch lay still, curled up in a ball, hoping he wont see trying to be as silent as she can. We hear THE SOUND OF A CHAINSAW in the b.g., buzzing away Finch gets up and runs deeper into the woods -- they way she came. As she runs into the chainsaw -- hanging on a tree, buzzi away. 70 She, like any other horror movie heroin, walks over to th bad thing. And when she does, Vilmer jumps out from nowhere, springi coyote. He attempts to grab the chainsaw from the tree, but Finch is biting his other arm and causes him to stop. She gets free, and starts to run -- I mean fast, fast. As hard as she could, away from Vilmer. But, what she doesn't see is a cord -- a trip wire in fro and she trips it. A rope catches her foot and drags her across the woods, and right into a meshing holding wooden sticks, with shav The rope drags her leg directly into the two plate of spi which mash in on her leg -- trapping her. She screams in pain. Vilmer walks up at a comfortable pace.

dialogues.speaker: VILMER
dialogues.text: Your death is my Sanctuary. Your peace is my hell. And if your living hell grows through the straight and narrow -- Then my friend, you will die in my blood- -stained hands on this moonlit morn.

dialogues.text: Over the darkness, we HEAR everything from now on. the CHAINSAW, REVIN' UP. The chainsaw CUTTING through something, HER She SCREAMS The BUZZING gets louder and LOUDER 71 More high pitched female SCREAMS The BUZZING IS VERY LOUD NOW. She almost MOANS -- then tries to SCREAM She is out of BREATH, almost The SAW is RIPPING THROUGH HER, you can hear it. She lets out a weak scream -- and another, but the last at all, but a blood-soaked  gargle.

This is what you deserve, and I'm giving it to you. (breathing heavily) Do you feel it, I'm fucking you up real good, Oh yeah! You bitch! Over Vilmers dialogue we can still hear the chainsaw, and
